subject: Special offer from our store
body: 2. The testacea which are immoveable live by a fluid which percolates through the dense parts of the sea, and being digested because it is lighter than the sea water, thus returns to its original nature. That this fluid exists in the sea, and is capable of infiltration is manifest, and may be proved by experiment; for if anyone will make a thin waxen vessel, and sink it empty in the sea, in a night and a day, it may be taken up full of water, which is drinkable.
